title: How to Make Melon Salad

steps.headline: In a large bowl, combine the fruit, nuts, and mint together.
In a separate small bowl, beat the juice, oil, and honey.
Pour the dressing onto the salad.
Toss in the feta cheese.
Serve.
steps.description: Scoop a desired amount of melon salad in a serving bowl. Garnish with mint if desired. Enjoy!

steps.headline: In a small mixing bowl, add the tomato, cucumber, and onion.
Sprinkle the vinegar, a tablespoon of oil, salt, and pepper over the vegetables.
Place the vegetables in the fridge to chill for about 30 minutes.
Make the dressing.
steps.description: Whisk the lime juice, syrup, and the rest of the oil. Add a desired amount of salt and pepper. Whisk until well-combined.

steps.headline: Add the cubed cantaloupe in a large bowl and toss the dressing over it.
Fold in the tomato mixture and add it to the salad.
Serve.

text: Watermelon and Cantaloupe Salad In a large bowl, combine the fruit, nuts, and mint together.  In a separate small bowl, beat the juice, oil, and honey.  Pour the dressing onto the salad.  Toss in the feta cheese. Mix. Serve. Scoop a desired amount of melon salad in a serving bowl. Garnish with mint if desired. Enjoy! Tomato and Melon Salad In a small mixing bowl, add the tomato, cucumber, and onion.  Sprinkle the vinegar, a tablespoon of oil, salt, and pepper over the vegetables. Toss and combine. Place the vegetables in the fridge to chill for about 30 minutes.  Make the dressing. Whisk the lime juice, syrup, and the rest of the oil. Add a desired amount of salt and pepper. Whisk until well-combined. Add the cubed cantaloupe in a large bowl and toss the dressing over it.  Fold in the tomato mixture and add it to the salad.  Serve. Scoop a desired amount of melon salad in a serving bowl. Garnish with mint if desired. Enjoy! Fresh Melon Fruit Salad Mix the honey, lime peel, and lime juice into a large bowl.  Stir in the rest of the ingredients. Add in the melon, honeydew, and watermelon. Toss gently and mix. Place the salad in the fridge to chill for about 1 hour.  Remove the salad from the fridge and mix it gently with a wooden spoon.  Serve. Scoop a desired amount of melon salad in a serving bowl. Garnish with mint if desired. Enjoy! Summer Greens & Melon Salad Chill the onions and ice water Mix the onion and ice water in a large bowl. Place it in the fridge to chill for about 30 minutes so the onions can get rid of their sharp edges. Wash and dry the salad greens.  Tear the salad greens into bite-sized pieces. Place them in a large salad bowl. Drain the onions from the ice water and dry them.  Add the melon, herbs, salt, pepper, sunflower seeds, and drained onions over the salad greens. Mix. Beat the olive oil and vinegar together to make a dressing.  Sprinkle the dressing over the salad. Toss the salad together. Serve. Scoop a desired amount of melon salad in a serving bowl. Garnish with mint if desired. Enjoy! Chili-Lime Melon Salad Place the melon in a large salad bowl.  Drizzle the lime juice, salt, and chili powder over the melon.  Add the cheese, cilantro, and pepitas over the salad. Toss until well-combined. Place the salad in the fridge to chill for about an hour.  Serve. Scoop a desired amount of melon salad in a serving bowl. Garnish with mint if desired. Enjoy! Strawberry Melon Salad In a large salad bowl, Whisk the yogurt, honey, and lemon juice until beaten and the mixture is smooth.  Add the fruit. Fold in the watermelon balls, strawberries, and cantaloupe balls. Combine and toss the salad together.  Serve. Scoop a desired amount of melon salad in a serving bowl. Garnish with mint if desired. Enjoy!
